ratings.rComments: Probably the worst professor I've had so far. Lectures are long, unfocused, and not reflective of what will be on the test, yet there's a grade for attendance. Tests are not too difficult as they are open book, but the questions that ar on the test will probably be a surprise. He's a nice guy to talk to but his rambling lectures are unbearable.

I wouldn't say that he is as awful as the reviews make him out to be. Material is very very interesting, but you have to really pay attention in class to get anything out of it. Book is huge but rarely used. He will sometimes call students out in class for questions that no one really knows the answer to. Overall I thought he was a nice guy

Lectures are generally confusing. All the information and understanding comes from the Internet because the book is super expensive and you don't even need to go to class except for participation points. The tests are very difficult due to questions requiring any combination of 5 options to get it correct. Thank God he's generous on curves.

Absolutely awful. Did not teach ANYTHING about Public Policy. Decided tot each a course about political thought and psychology of voters. Covered Rational, Cognitive, and Religious thought. Don't take this class with him. Take it with a different professor.

He's rude and enjoys picking on students.  Extreme liberal bias that will make even the leftist students roll their eyes at times.  Class however is pretty easy to get an A as long as instead of studying what the book says study what he says the book says because they aren't the same thing.

Seitz isn't as terrible as some of the reviews make him out to be but I would never take a class he teaches again. The discussion was disjointed and generally revolved around Seitz asking the students a question then interrupting halfway through to correct them before they finished. The quizzes were difficult and made little sense.
The worst teacher I have ever had. Class has nothing to do with POLS. It is like a psych class. DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING WITH HIM. He tries to trick you on the tests. Definitely, DEFINITELY avoid him
He's awesome and fun. Class is discussion based. You will learn a lot and it'll be very interesting. Everyone should take a class with Seitz! You'll enjoy it. Minimum work needed.
He is the worst professor I have ever had.  He killed my interest in public policy and I could not have disliked the class more.  I would say avoid any class with him.

Attendance was mandatory when he decided to take role. By far the rudest professor I've ever had. Material on exams rarely covered in class, no structure, assignments were due but nobody had them done because he was so unclear about his expectations. I will never take a class with him again.

Worst teacher I have ever had. If you can avoid taking this class, please do. He is ignorant, rude, demeaning to students, and makes the course so unnecessarily confusing. He refuses to tell you what upcoming exams are going to be about except the class RIGHT before the next time you see him for the exam. He never puts grades up either. THE WORST

I have never had a worse teacher in my life. What kind of person who has the audacity to call himself a Professor, fails the entire class on assignments he NEVER assigned. No one ever knows what's going on for the exams, this class is just a group of students being objected to torture for an hour and a half. DO NOT TAKE EVER.

Condescending and inappropriate. Always gives write ups and quizzes he said he assigned but noone in the class could recall. Tests are hard and he does not prepare students properly for them. I attended class regularly and rarely did I ever relate what he was saying to test materials

He was rude andinapprop riate. Often made comments that were suggestive,not funny just uncomfortable.Twice he took credit from the whole class for not turning in assignments that he never assigned or appeared on the syllabus.  Test prep is a joke,he gives an outline then tests material not mentioned. Does not allow anyone to question. condescending

This class can be challenging and the objectives may seem unclear at times. However, Seitz is one of the few professors who's teaching style and requirements are applicable to the world outside his classroom. Take this class! He rewards those who put in the effort and you gain an incredible understanding of public policy.

Is it easy, no. Did I put in more time than any other class, yes. Is it interesting, definitely. Do your work, put in the time, do what he suggests, and you'll really learn a lot. In retrospect, I realize how useful this class was. Go to class and office hours too. People whine about this class a lot, but I'm glad I took it.

The tests are challenging, but also very informational. He is also very generous with his curve so that helps a lot. He is a brilliant man. He has really helped me take my understanding of public policy to a whole new level. He enjoys talking with you in office hours if you go. You will be smarter when you leave his class.

Avoid him if you can. 220 is one of those core class for PS majors but try and take it when he isn't teaching it. No class structure at all and nothing he ever does seems to prepare you or relate to the tests that are graded on ridiculous curves anyway. He's also very narrow-minded and only allows his views to be used in class. Bad overall.

I had Seitz for two classes. Pretty much everything you've read is true. He's arrogant, he's inappropriate, and he's impossible to understand at times. Having said that, his classes were among the most enjoyable I've taken. Engage yourself, have a sense of humor and you'll be fine. Avoid professors like this, and you are doing yourself a disservice

Absolutely terrible. His lectures make no sense and don't relate to the tests at all. He uses them simply to force his extremely biased views on the entire class. Don't dare argue with him, your grade depends on it. His tests also make no sense and don't relate to class topics at all. How is he a teacher at the University of Illinois?

Do not take this class. Professor makes fun of students-names, clothes, sexual orientation, anything. No structure to class. Hardly discusses public policy. Extremely liberal, biased, and not up on current events like he claims to be. Don't even try to oppose his views, his opinion is ALWAYS right, no matter the subject. Horrible professor.

I can't quite tell you how bad this Professor is. I'm a Political Science major, loved all my classes, until this. There is no structure, no point, and Seitz is belligerent.  He'll attack personal appearance, anything if you disagree with him. This is coming from someone who agrees with most of his views as well. He is giving the department a bad n

Professor can be extremely inappropriate and tends to enjoy singling individuals out and alienating them for something as bizarre as the pronunciation of their name.  Also is extremely liberal bias and shows little structure to class.  Tests are very difficult and very hard to prepare for.  That said I would still recommend him based on curve of fi

I learned a lot in this class. You can tell he's incredibly smart, so his tests are difficult but he curves everything. I was able to get an A- without reading a single page of assigned material. He does say sexual things but it keeps things entertaining and humorous. If you are easily offended though then I would suggest another teacher.

Forces you to think.  There are no easy questions or answers.  Crazy curve on every quiz/test/final grad which is necessary because the tests/quiz's are ridiculously hard and impossible to study for. Teacher makes sexual jokes but I didn't find them offensive and I am a female.  I learned more in this class than any other class taken at U of I.
One word: avoid.  He is extremely biased and inappropriate.  His test questions are very subjective and he picks extremely dense articles. Take another class.

Very inappropriate in his sexual jokes and belittling of students. I understand that we're all adults, but his lack of professionalism even crosses into harassment at times. I'm shocked that he's gotten away with his antics over the years. Like others have said, it's a shame, as the instructor is intelligent, knowledgeable, and actively engages students.

Very intelligent, jokes a lot but makes class interesting and fun(what other prof would talk about orgies in class) no text book required only have to read ws journal and ny times. if your sensitive and cry a lot don't take his class. if you want a challenge and want to learn a lot take his class. PLUS huge curve on exams. great professor!

Terrible teacher. Tests are ridiculous and arbitrary. If you disagree with something he says he will call you stupid. Extremely unprofessional (talked about having orgies in office hours???). I'm not sure how this guy is still teaching here. In one word, awful.

The man is so full of sh*t its ridiculous. He knows what he's talking about, but he teaches his far-out views as fact, and he'll belittle you if you disagree or even question him. Unfair, completely arbitrary tests that don't test how well you grasp the material. Huge case of little man syndrome, Napoleon complex. Needs to grow up.
Is he here to teach his students or to brainwash them?
Arrogant, condescending, and an overall jerk.  I agreed with his politics and I still would get uncomfortable in class with his closed-minded opinion and belittling of students.  Stay away.
subjective, closed minded, rude, major napoleon complex... avoid his classes at all costs... take another year to graduate, switch majors, anything...

I don't care what anyone else says, this guy is great. Come to class with an open mind and a sense of humor. The only people who don't get along with this teacher are people who take themselves far too seriously. Do the readings, go to office hours. Tests are unusual but fair...one of the best teacher I've had EVER.

He is rude and does not create a learning environment condusive to an exchange in viewpoints, he only teaches his beliefs and if you attempt to express other views, he shuts you down and makes you feel stupid. Don't take this class unless you are a bleeding heart liberal.

Horrible teacher. You'll learn what is on the test the day before, please note it's all about his doctines and biases.  Paper has no guidelines. no one knew what to write beyond  feeding his overt biases.  He may be intelligent but that doesn't translate to effective teaching.  He's so liberal he could make Michael Moore blush. Don't take!
Very unprofessional. Made fun of the students frequently and used demeaning language. Also, I couldn't tell where Ben Franklin's *ss ended and Seitz's lips began.

Obviously brilliant, and shares political views freely.  Expects students to have an defend their opinions, and is willing to tear opinions apart when unfounded.  Discussion based classes follow a very loose syllabus, but that lends to some very fun and engaging discussions that are allowed to take their course.

Clearly intelligent, but very arrogant. He believes his views are the only views that are correct.  If you think the way he does, you will do well in his class.  Frequent discussion, but he does not allow actual argument.  No clarity in the class whatsoever, the curves hurts you, and the final paper has no guidelines, you have no idea what to write

I didnt find his views to be that much in the curriculum.  Definetely there, but if you disagree what is more fun than arguing with someone about it.  Discussion based and well done.  A great guy.  Quite funny and silly unlike many arrogant teachers.

Seitz classes are based on discussion rather than lecture.  He facilitates the discussion skillfully so you learn the material well.  He is clearly a brilliant person.  If you can tolerate his childish sexual humor and don't mind a liberal professor who shares his personal political biases in class, I highly recommend him.

Prefers discussion to lecture. However, he has no qualms about tearing apart conservative students' arguments. This is unfortunate for everyone, as it turns discussion back into lecture. At the same time, he's ridiculously brilliant, and can help you with any questions you have - if you can find him. Also, beware mystery dance.
Goofy and funny guy. Laid back class where everyone is relaxed. Tests suck, I suggest you talk to him or look online for summaries of the books.
Seitz was awesome for Public Policy. He had quite a mouth on him as well. The class structure was pretty cool and his tests weren't that difficult. All in all it was a good time.

If you agree with every single part of his ideology, you'll do fine.  His political agenda is the syllabus.  No textbooks, only newspapers, so he presents his views on current events as holy writ while anything else has to be wrong. Childish outbursts pepper the unprofessional environment. If you want a valuable academic experience this is not it.
Worst professor i have ever had. stay away from this class.
No Comments
Prefers discussion to lecture; Forces you to defend your points and loves to play devil's advocate; Tests are not that bad if you have a basic idea of what is going on
Tests are VERY hard, but he is very approachable
the TAs quit in the first month and he had to lead all the discussion sections himself...dude is smart...too bad he'll never be able to convey that knowledge to anyone else
Very knowledgeable and approachable.  I think it would be impossible to completely comprehend everything he says, but you will learn.
worst professor in the world
Great teacher, makes you think about the issues
good teacher
intelligent man, very educated on the subject of political theory.
Tests SUCK!!!!!!!!
